title: Marcel Broodthaers 1970 vacu-form artwork
content:
I would be very grateful if someone could identify this font or something very similar.

Thank you in advance.

h.p.

Font: 

 Custom die-punch typeface 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Broodthaers21020802.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/typophile.com/files/Broodthaers21020802.jpg) | 158.22 KB |
author: hypepilot

comments.content:
Given the date of the original and the manufacturing process, the original was most likely a custom die-punch typeface (they actually look like the sort of letters you'd draw with an architect's lettering guide). Here are a few contemporary digital fonts that may help you replicate the look:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/slim-james/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/slim-james/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/slim-james/") [you'd have to artificially expand it]  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/diamante/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/diamante/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/diamante/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/diamante-serial/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/diamante-serial/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/diamante-serial/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/refrigerator-deluxe/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/refrigerator-deluxe/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/refrigerator-deluxe/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/stratum2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/stratum2/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/stratum2/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fort-foundry/industry-inc/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fort-foundry/industry-inc/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fort-foundry/industry-inc/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/oxide-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/oxide-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/oxide-pro/")

And, of course, there is the old standby, Eurostile (condensed):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/eurostile/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/eurostile/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/eurostile/")

Good suggestions Bob and Kevin.  
Almost looks like license plate letters in a jurisdiction where the need to squeeze in more than a few letters allows this width. But the \_Q\_ is a disaster. Too close to \_O\_ -- ignore the comma, \_O\_ would look like \_C\_ with the gap closed.  
BTW looking at \_J\_, \_M\_, and \_W\_ leads me to believe that this is monospaced.  
Don
The key is the slight step back on the upper part of the B - that is why Neutraliser Sans will get you close.

Wow!

Thank you so much for this. It is very much appreciated. I really like the industrial machine look of it. Neutralizer and Stratum2 look pretty good to my eye.

I like Don's comment about the Q being a disaster!

I am going to hold off marking it as resolved just in case a few more suggestions come in.

h.p.

Based on Kevin's (kthomps5 ) thoughts of "the sort of letters you'd draw with an architect's lettering guide"

I found this:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nowak/engineer/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nowak/engineer/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nowak/engineer/regular/")

Does anyone know of anything else that might be similar?

Take a look at these license plate fonts. I have not included the ones with serifs or the ones that are significantly wider than your specimen.  
Driver Gothic  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/driver-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/driver-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/driver-gothic/")  
BF Corpa Gothic  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/brassfonts/corpa-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/brassfonts/corpa-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/brassfonts/corpa-gothic/")  
Vehicle JNL  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/vehicle/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/vehicle/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/vehicle/")  
Penitentiary Gothic  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/penitentiary-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317203131/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/penitentiary-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/penitentiary-gothic/")  
Don

Hey I just want to say that I wanted to resolve this an give credit to

kthomps5  
donshottype  
bojev

Because the lettering appears to be custom-made and thus all their suggestions are greatly appreciated.

It doesn't appear that I am able to credit all.

h.p.
